alert.note: Alert for Chilton (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 1:41AM CST until January 04 at 5:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Autauga, Bibb, Chilton, Coosa, Dallas and Perry. * WHEN...Until 445 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 141 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clanton, Marion, Jemison, Thorsby, Maplesville, Billingsley, Parnell, Plecher, Lawley, Chilton County Motor Sports Park, Paul M Grist State Park, Pooles Crossroads, Gap Of The Mountain, Mitchell Lake, Lay Lake Dam, Higgins Ferry Park, Lay Lake, Stanton, Plantersville and Isabella.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
